page.title: 19THE GROWING UP OF LONGTON
page.content:
A piece of prose written in memory of a childhood in Longton before the planners from South Ribble Council took over the area from Preston Rural District Council.
They have taken away my playgrounds. They have destroyed all the wild places. The streams have been piped or covered. The woodland is now a car park. The Brick Croft is bare and flattened, The footpaths all paved and quite clean. There are no weeds in the parkland And no horses allowed on the Rec. Where are the children to play NOW? Perhaps everyone has grown old.
